content:
AnnotationDocumentPaginator Class

In this Article

Provides a DocumentPaginator for printing a document together with its associated annotations.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class AnnotationDocumentPaginator : System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator
  • AnnotationDocumentPaginator

Inherited Members

Remarks

The AnnotationDocumentPaginator class wraps the DocumentPaginator specified to the AnnotationDocumentPaginator constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.

Constructors summary

AnnotationDocumentPaginator(DocumentPaginator,Stream)

Initializes a new instance of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class based on a specified DocumentPaginator and annotation storage Stream.
AnnotationDocumentPaginator(DocumentPaginator,AnnotationStore)

Initializes a new instance of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class based on a specified DocumentPaginator and AnnotationStore.
AnnotationDocumentPaginator(DocumentPaginator,Stream,FlowDirection)

Initializes a new instance of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class based on a specified DocumentPaginator, annotation storage Stream, and text FlowDirection.
AnnotationDocumentPaginator(DocumentPaginator,AnnotationStore,FlowDirection)

Initializes a new instance of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class based on a specified DocumentPaginator, AnnotationStore, and text FlowDirection.

Properties summary

IsPageCountValid

Gets a value that indicates whether stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount* is the total number of pages.
PageCount

Gets a value that indicates the number of pages currently formatted.
PageSize

Gets or sets the suggested width and height of each page.
Source

Gets the source document that is being paginated.

Methods summary

CancelAsync(Object)

Cancels all asynchronous operations initiated with a given userState object.
ComputePageCount()

Forces a pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, and sets stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true.
ComputePageCountAsync(Object)

Starts an asynchronous pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, and sets stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true when it is finished.
GetPage(Int32)

Returns a DocumentPage together with associated user-annotations for a specified page number.
GetPageAsync(Int32,Object)

Asynchronously returns a DocumentPage together with associated user-annotations for a specified page number.

Constructors

  • AnnotationDocumentPaginator(DocumentPaginator,Stream)

    Initializes a new instance of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class based on a specified DocumentPaginator and annotation storage Stream.

    public AnnotationDocumentPaginator (System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator originalPaginator, System.IO.Stream annotationStore);

    Parameters

    • originalPaginator
      System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator

      The document to add the printed annotations to.

    • annotationStore
      Stream

      The annotation storage stream to retrieve the annotations from.

    Remarks

    By default this constructor sets the text flow direction to FlowDirection. If needed you can use one of the alternate AnnotationDocumentPaginator constructor overloads to set the text FlowDirection to a different setting.

    The AnnotationDocumentPaginator class wraps the DocumentPaginator specified to the AnnotationDocumentPaginator constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.

  • AnnotationDocumentPaginator(DocumentPaginator,AnnotationStore)

    Initializes a new instance of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class based on a specified DocumentPaginator and AnnotationStore.

    public AnnotationDocumentPaginator (System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator originalPaginator, System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore annotationStore);

    Parameters

    • originalPaginator
      System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator

      The document to add the printed annotations to.

    • annotationStore
      AnnotationStore

      The store to retrieve the annotations from.

    Remarks

    By default this constructor sets the text flow direction to FlowDirection. If needed you can use one of the alternate AnnotationDocumentPaginator constructor overloads to set the text FlowDirection to a different setting.

    The AnnotationDocumentPaginator class wraps the DocumentPaginator specified to the AnnotationDocumentPaginator constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.

    Example

    The following example shows use of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator constructor. 

    PrintDialog prntDialog = new PrintDialog();
if ((bool)prntDialog.ShowDialog())
{
    // XpsDocumentWriter.Write() may change the current
    // directory to "My Documents" or another user selected
    // directory for storing the print document.  Save the
    // current directory and restore it after calling Write().
    string docDir = Directory.GetCurrentDirectory();

    // Create and XpsDocumentWriter for the selected printer.
    XpsDocumentWriter xdw = PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter(
                                        prntDialog.PrintQueue);

    // Print the document with annotations.
    try
    {
        xdw.Write(_annotHelper.GetAnnotationDocumentPaginator(
            _xpsDocument.GetFixedDocumentSequence()));
    }
    catch (PrintingCanceledException)
    {
        // If in the PrintDialog the user chooses a file-based
        // output, such as the "MS Office Document Image Writer",
        // the user confirms or specifies the actual output
        // filename when the xdw.write operation executes.
        // If the user clicks "Cancel" in the filename
        // dialog a PrintingCanceledException is thrown
        // which we catch here and ignore.
        // MessageBox.Show("Print output cancelled");
    }

    // Restore the original document directory to "current".
    Directory.SetCurrentDirectory(docDir);
}

    Dim prntDialog As New PrintDialog()
If CBool(prntDialog.ShowDialog()) Then
	' XpsDocumentWriter.Write() may change the current
	' directory to "My Documents" or another user selected
	' directory for storing the print document.  Save the
	' current directory and restore it after calling Write().
	Dim docDir As String = Directory.GetCurrentDirectory()

	' Create and XpsDocumentWriter for the selected printer.
	Dim xdw As XpsDocumentWriter = PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter(prntDialog.PrintQueue)

	' Print the document with annotations.
	Try
		xdw.Write(_annotHelper.GetAnnotationDocumentPaginator(_xpsDocument.GetFixedDocumentSequence()))
	Catch e1 As PrintingCanceledException
		' If in the PrintDialog the user chooses a file-based
		' output, such as the "MS Office Document Image Writer",
		' the user confirms or specifies the actual output
		' filename when the xdw.write operation executes.
		' If the user clicks "Cancel" in the filename
		' dialog a PrintingCanceledException is thrown
		' which we catch here and ignore.
                End Try

	' Restore the original document directory to "current".
	Directory.SetCurrentDirectory(docDir)
End If

    // ------------------ GetAnnotationDocumentPaginator ------------------
/// <summary>
///   Returns a paginator for printing annotations.</summary>
/// <param name="fds">
///   The FixedDocumentSequence containing
///   the annotations to print.</param>
/// <returns>
///   An paginator for printing the document's annotations.</returns>
public AnnotationDocumentPaginator GetAnnotationDocumentPaginator(
                                            FixedDocumentSequence fds)
{
    return new AnnotationDocumentPaginator(
                   fds.DocumentPaginator, _annotService.Store);
}

    ' ------------------ GetAnnotationDocumentPaginator ------------------
''' <summary>
'''   Returns a paginator for printing annotations.</summary>
''' <param name="fds">
'''   The FixedDocumentSequence containing
'''   the annotations to print.</param>
''' <returns>
'''   An paginator for printing the document's annotations.</returns>
Public Function GetAnnotationDocumentPaginator(ByVal fds As FixedDocumentSequence) As AnnotationDocumentPaginator
	Return New AnnotationDocumentPaginator(fds.DocumentPaginator, _annotService.Store)
End Function
  • AnnotationDocumentPaginator(DocumentPaginator,Stream,FlowDirection)

    Initializes a new instance of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class based on a specified DocumentPaginator, annotation storage Stream, and text FlowDirection.

    public AnnotationDocumentPaginator (System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator originalPaginator, System.IO.Stream annotationStore, System.Windows.FlowDirection flowDirection);

    Parameters

    • originalPaginator
      System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator

      The document to add the printed annotations to.

    • annotationStore
      Stream

      The annotation storage stream to retrieve the annotations from.

    • flowDirection
      FlowDirection

      The text flow direction, FlowDirection or FlowDirection.

    Remarks

    The AnnotationDocumentPaginator class wraps the DocumentPaginator specified to the AnnotationDocumentPaginator constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.

  • AnnotationDocumentPaginator(DocumentPaginator,AnnotationStore,FlowDirection)

    Initializes a new instance of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class based on a specified DocumentPaginator, AnnotationStore, and text FlowDirection.

    public AnnotationDocumentPaginator (System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator originalPaginator, System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore annotationStore, System.Windows.FlowDirection flowDirection);

    Parameters

    • originalPaginator
      System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator

      The document to add the printed annotations to.

    • annotationStore
      AnnotationStore

      The store to retrieve the annotations from.

    • flowDirection
      FlowDirection

      The text flow direction, FlowDirection or FlowDirection.

    Remarks

    The AnnotationDocumentPaginator class wraps the DocumentPaginator specified to the AnnotationDocumentPaginator constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.

Properties

  • IsPageCountValid

    Gets a value that indicates whether stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount* is the total number of pages.

    public override bool IsPageCountValid { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if pagination is complete and stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount* represents the total number of pages; otherwise, false if pagination is in process and stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount* represents the number of pages currently formatted.

    Remarks

    IsPageCountValid may switch from true to false and PageCount recomputed if a change to the content or PageSize triggers repagination.

  • PageCount

    Gets a value that indicates the number of pages currently formatted.

    public override int PageCount { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      If stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* is true, the total number of annotation pages; otherwise if stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* is false, the number of pages currently formatted (pagination in process).

    Remarks

    IsPageCountValid may change from true to false and PageCount recomputed if a change to the content or PageSize triggers repagination.

  • PageSize

    Gets or sets the suggested width and height of each page.

    public override System.Windows.Size PageSize { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Size

      The suggested width and height for formatting pages.

    Remarks

    PageSize gets or sets the suggested size for formatting pages. Use the Size property to get the actual size of the page (if it is required the actual size may be cropped from the suggested PageSize).

  • Source

    Gets the source document that is being paginated.

    public override System.Windows.Documents.IDocumentPaginatorSource Source { get; }

    Property Value

    • IDocumentPaginatorSource

      The source document that is being paginated.

Methods

  • CancelAsync(Object)

    Cancels all asynchronous operations initiated with a given userState object.

    public override void CancelAsync (object userState);

    Parameters

    • userState
      Object

      The unique application-defined identifier passed in the call to start the asynchronous operation.

  • ComputePageCount()

    Forces a pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, and sets stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true.

    public override void ComputePageCount ();

    Remarks

    Immediately after ComputePageCount returns, IsPageCountValid will be true and the PageCount property will reflect the total number of pages.

    The number of pages may change if the annotation content is modified or the PageSize is changed.

  • ComputePageCountAsync(Object)

    Starts an asynchronous pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, and sets stem.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true when it is finished.

    public override void ComputePageCountAsync (object userState);

    Parameters

    • userState
      Object

      An application-defined object for identifying the asynchronous operation.

    Remarks

    The userState parameter is intended for use with CancelAsync method if the application wishes to cancel the asynchronous operation before completion.

  • GetPage(Int32)

    Returns a DocumentPage together with associated user-annotations for a specified page number.

    public override System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage GetPage (int pageNumber);

    Parameters

    • pageNumber
      Int32

      The zero-based page number of the DocumentPage to return.

    Returns

    • DocumentPage

      The DocumentPage for the specified pageNumber; or DocumentPage, if the specified pageNumber does not exist.

  • GetPageAsync(Int32,Object)

    Asynchronously returns a DocumentPage together with associated user-annotations for a specified page number.

    public override void GetPageAsync (int pageNumber, object userState);

    Parameters

    • pageNumber
      Int32

      The zero-based page number of the DocumentPage to retrieve.

    • userState
      Object

      An application-defined object that is used to identify the asynchronous operation.

    Remarks

    The userState parameter is intended for use with CancelAsync method if the application wishes to cancel the asynchronous operation before completion.
